image.altText: A composite image of eight different faces of men and women of different ages.

items.synopsis: As Australians prepare to vote in a historic referendum, the ABC's Voice correspondent Dan Bourchier travels to the north, west and east of the country for Four Corners and finds a nation grappling with its future.

title.children: The Voice asks a simple question, but Australia's answer is complicated

image.altText: A brown snake with its tongue out on a rock

items.synopsis: Experts say how you respond in the minutes after a snake bite could be the difference between life and death. It comes after the tragic death of a man bitten by a suspected brown snake while trying to save a friend in North Queensland.

title.children: Snake season has turned deadly. Here's what to do if you get bitten

image.altText: danny in hospital with his parents

items.synopsis: Danny has leukaemia and needs a bone marrow transplant. The life-saving treatment will cost his family half a million dollars.

title.children: Six-year-old Danny needs a bone marrow transplant, but he's not covered by Medicare

image.altText: DeanYates

items.synopsis: WikiLeaks leaked a video showing two of former foreign correspondent Dean Yates's colleagues being killed. The truth left him reeling.

title.children: 'I felt responsible': Dean was guilt-ridden his staff died on his watch. Then WikiLeaks released the footage

items.synopsis: Data released from Copernicus, a branch of the European Union Space Programme, shows August was 1.59C warmer than 1850–1900 levels, following a 1.6C increase in July.

title.children: Global temperatures exceed 1.5C above pre-industrial levels for first time

image.altText: A young boy looking at the camera while kneeling near a pile of rubble.

items.synopsis: Everyone left in Moulay Ibrahim has a story of their narrow escape — just ask 11-year-old Abdarazak Abou Aalam, whose tragic tour of the town starts at his neighbour's house, which was destroyed in Friday's earthquake.

title.children: In this devastated Moroccan village, an 11yo earthquake survivor gives a tour of the rubble

image.altText: A smiling man wearing a suit embraces a woman wearing a football uniform

items.synopsis: Spanish Football Federation chief Luis Rubiales, engulfed in a scandal over giving an unsolicited kiss to a player on the women's World Cup team last month, says he will resign from his position.

title.children: Spain's soccer chief Luis Rubiales announces resignation over unsolicited kiss

image.altText: A little boy in a fluffy hoodie plays with his mother in a living room.

items.synopsis: Max Knight's mother begged him not to leave her as he lay dying in her arms after a fire on their Queensland property. His dad was badly injured in the blaze and remains in hospital.

title.children: Community rallies after 5yo dies in mum's arms following Father's Day fire

image.altText: Composite image of Darcy Moore, Nic Newman and Charlie Cameron.

items.synopsis: Two clear premiership favourites emerge from the first weekend of AFL finals, but a pair of dark horses suddenly loom as a threat to be feared. We digest a huge weekend of finals footy.

title.children: AFL Round-Up: Two favourites stake their flag claims, but beware a pair of finals dark horses

image.altText: A woman stands and talks on the phone inside an office, next to a large sculpture of the Airbnb logo which is larger than her

items.synopsis: There is little evidence short-stay accommodation providers such as Airbnb are to blame for Queensland's worsening rental affordability, according to a University of Queensland report.

title.children: 'No alignment' between Airbnb-style properties and rent hikes, report finds

image.altText: A woman sits on the floor with her three children reading a book.

items.synopsis: The Australian Multiple Birth Association is ramping up calls for the government to consider additional parental leave for parents of multiples, in order to help address their unique challenges.

title.children: 'It's demoralising': Multiple-birth families call for additional paid parental leave

image.altText: Crime figure Gavin Preston looks unsmilingly into the camera as he poses for a photo.

items.synopsis: Police continue to search for two men after a fatal shooting at a Keilor cafe, as CBD traders raise fears about Melbourne's reputation.

title.children: Search continues for two offenders after fatal cafe shooting of underworld figure Gavin Preston

image.altText: Ukraine drone attack

items.synopsis: Russia launches nearly three dozen drones at Kyiv overnight, with blasts ringing out across the Ukrainian capital and the surrounding region for around two hours, Ukrainian officials say.

title.children: Russia launches overnight drone attack on Ukrainian capital

image.altText: Oxfam office

items.synopsis: With unions embedding trials of the four-day work week in industrial agreements, is this the moment the working-hour-reducing concept goes mainstream?

title.children: Four-day week enshrined in first Australian union agreement, with concept spreading

image.altText: Man in red jacket with light on his head

items.synopsis: More than 150 rescuers are racing to save an American researcher who became trapped in a cave in southern Türkiye, moving him halfway to the surface.

title.children: Caver trapped 1,000 metres deep in Türkiye is moved halfway to surface

image.altText: Rainbow light in the form of soundwaves on a black background.

items.synopsis: There's a colour of noise for every mood. But are these sounds really useful for getting to sleep, or concentrating better? That depends on you.

title.children: Brown, white, pink, or blue — what is coloured noise? And does it really affect our brains?

image.altText: Man wears wielding mask and works inside a massive tube.

items.synopsis: Wind tower producers are calling for supply mandates to ensure Australian businesses do not lose out to cheaper overseas alternatives during procurement rounds for energy developments.

title.children: The reason why Australia's two wind tower producers have no orders

image.altText: A woman holding an ABC microphone in a street covered in debris.

items.synopsis: Your place for today's latest news, as it happens.

title.children: Inside the Morocco earthquake zone, Djokovic and Medvedev meet at US Open men's final. Get in The Loop

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: After massive rally against Daniil Medvedev, Novak Djokovic has collapsed to the ground out of exhaustion. Djokovic is two sets up against Medvedev, having won the second in a tie-break just moments ago. He leads 6-3, 7-6 (7/5). We are waiting on a medical time-out as Medvedev's trainers give his shoulder some treatment, but play should be back underway very soon.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Djokovic collapses on court after marathon rally

props.alt: Djokovic lying on the ground of a tennis green

children.content: After massive rally against Daniil Medvedev, Novak Djokovic has collapsed to the ground out of exhaustion.
Djokovic is two sets up against Medvedev, having won the second in a tie-break just moments ago.
We are waiting on a medical time-out as Medvedev's trainers give his shoulder some treatment, but play should be back underway very soon.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Air quality in Sydney's east this morning remains very poor as key hazard reduction burns continue today. Sarah Hawke in Sydney reports: "Smoke has settled across many parts of Sydney from the burns at Holsworthy in the south west and and in the Ku-ring-gai Chase National Park in in the north. "The Rural Fire Service says these areas haven't been burnt for a number of years and if fuel loads aren't reduced hundreds if not thousands of homes would be at risk during the fire season." The air quality in Sydney's east is rated as very poor and it's poor across the north west.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Very poor air quality in parts of Sydney following reduction burns

children.content: Air quality in Sydney's east this morning remains very poor as key hazard reduction burns continue today.
"Smoke has settled across many parts of Sydney from the burns at Holsworthy in the south west and and in the Ku-ring-gai Chase National Park in in the north.
"The Rural Fire Service says these areas haven't been burnt for a number of years and if fuel loads aren't reduced hundreds if not thousands of homes would be at risk during the fire season."
The air quality in Sydney's east is rated as very poor and it's poor across the north west.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Police have arrested four people over the alleged abduction and stabbing of a man in Preston, in Melbourne's inner north-east last night. Officers responded to a call from a hire company about a car that had been stolen in Northcote about 9:40pm Sunday. Police were able to track the vehicle using police helicopters while the Dog Squad followed the vehicle at a distance. A man was let out of the car at the intersection of High Street and Bell Street in Preston. More details here:
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Four arrested following alleged stabbing in Melbourne

featuredLink.title: Four people arrested over alleged abduction and stabbing in Melbourne's inner north-east

children.content: Police have arrested four people over the
alleged abduction and stabbing of a man in Preston, in Melbourne's inner north-east last night.
Officers responded to a call from a hire company about a
car that had been stolen in Northcote about 9:40pm Sunday.
Police were able to track the vehicle using police helicopters
the Dog Squad followed the vehicle at a distance.
A man was let out of the car at the intersection of High Street and Bell Street in Preston.

image.altText: School sign

items.synopsis: A man has died after attempting to remove a snake that had coiled around his friend's leg in a tragic accident during school celebrations in northern Queensland.

title.children: 'Despite heroic measures, unable to be revived': Man dies from snake bite at school reunion

image.altText: newspaper clippings surrounding old photographs of a man

items.synopsis: Premier Daniel Andrews's new inquiry has been tasked with untangling a web of horrors relating to just 18 Victorian government schools. The single case of serial paedophile headmaster William Landman shows why a broader examination is needed, writes investigative reporter Russell Jackson.

title.children: Prolific paedophile William Landman was a criminal before he was a teacher. He and other abusers will not be examined in a new inquiry

image.altText: A woman working on a laptop in a board room.

items.synopsis: A new study by proxy advisor Ownership Matters has found one in three non-executive directors at Australia's biggest 300 companies are women, but they remain substantially under-represented as chairs and CEOs, and are paid less than their male counterparts.

title.children: Nice work if you can get it: Australian boardrooms dominated by men earning over $1m despite more female directors

image.altText: Victor Shaw with father Alex on a boat.

items.synopsis: When Victor Shaw discovered that scammers had stolen his dad's life savings, he held out little hope of a positive outcome. But then a letter arrived from ANZ that left him stunned.

title.children: 'Absolutely astonished': Victor's dad lost his life savings to scammers, but the bank paid it all back

image.altText: Anthony Albanese stands behind a podium that says G20.

items.synopsis: As the hosts of the G20 tried to steer discussions towards other issues, the Ukraine war still dominated, reinforcing the deep global divisions.

title.children: Western leaders insist they got what they wanted out of the G20, but Russia has called it a victory

image.altText: A close up of marigold flowers in an urban environment.

items.synopsis: Green roofs are proven to boost biodiversity, energy efficiency and people's wellbeing. But, unlike other countries, Australia's big cities have just a few dozen.

title.children: Green roofs bring many benefits, but gardening up high poses some unique challenges

image.altText: An illustration of a car, house, health kit and book in an opened gift box

items.synopsis: Some experts say a salary sacrifice or a salary package agreement can help maximise income and reduce tax debt — depending on the industry you're in and what your employer offers.

title.children: Ever heard of salary sacrifice? Here's what it is and how it can help reduce debt

image.altText: Pareto phone graphic

items.synopsis: The ABC can reveal former staff of hacked tele-fundraiser Pareto Phone were not told for weeks that their highly sensitive employment information was published on the dark web.

title.children: Pareto Phone workers not told criminal checks among 320,000 files published in hack

image.altText: qld premier annastacia palaszczuk and prime minister anthony albanese stand on a stage at a conference

items.synopsis: Acting Premier Steven Miles dismissed concerns about Premier Annastacia Palaszczuk's leadership and said it was an "honour" to serve as deputy in the wake of gloomy polling.

title.children: Latest poll 'undeniably bad news' for Palaszczuk and Queensland Labor

image.altText: The tails of Qantas planes showing the flying kangaroo pass each other at Sydney Airport.

items.synopsis: Qantas' labour hire practices have come under intense scrutiny in recent years, and it could have a long-term impact on the company, writes Gareth Hutchens.

title.children: Another Joyce legacy? Qantas' treatment of its workers inspired an attempt to overhaul the law

image.altText: A close up image from the side of a man with glasses.

items.synopsis: It’s tucked away in six of Australia’s airports, well hidden from the average traveller. Inside, some of Australia’s most powerful enjoy five-star food and wine as they await their flights. But when you ask about the Chairman’s Lounge, Qantas has no comment.

title.children: Inside the secretive and controversial Qantas Chairman’s Lounge

image.altText: Ashton Kutcher and Mila Kunis appear in a video apologising.

items.synopsis: The co-stars of That 70's Show take to Instagram following a backlash over letters they wrote attesting to convicted rapist Danny Masterson's positive traits.

title.children: 'We're sorry': Ashton Kutcher and Mila Kunis apologise for pain caused by support letters for Danny Masterson

image.altText: An NRL player points at his arm, telling the referee he was bitten

items.synopsis: Kalyn Ponga's 89th-minute penalty goal is the difference in Newcastle, as the Knights win 30-28 in the second period of extra time to end the Canberra Raiders' season.

title.children: Jack Wighton reported for alleged bite as Raiders knocked out in extra time by Knights

image.altText: Valentine Holmes

items.synopsis: NRL star Valentine Holmes, a member of the 2023 Origin-winning Queensland Maroons team, faces a league and club investigation after posting a photo to Instagram on Sunday morning.

title.children: 'Conducting an investigation': North Queensland Cowboys probe photo posted by Valentine Holmes on social media
